Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.Drill Class Reference

Base class for all Drills. More...

Inheritance diagram for Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.Drill:

Public Member Functions

void LoadAttachment (GameObject attachment, float offset)
 The method loads and fixes an attachment to the drill's attachment point.
 

Public Attributes

GameObject indicator
 Reference to the Indicator GameObject indicating the cutting area.
 
GameObject prefab = null
 Prefab storing the GameObject attachment currently attached to the Drill.
 
Material material
 
SteamVR_Action_Boolean actionIndicate = SteamVR_Input.GetAction<SteamVR_Action_Boolean>("instrument", "Indicate")
 A boolean describing if the Indicate action is executed for the given instrument.
 
SteamVR_Action_Boolean actionInteract = SteamVR_Input.GetAction<SteamVR_Action_Boolean>("instrument", "Interact")
 A boolean describing if the Interact action is executed for the given instrument.
 

Private Member Functions

void Start ()
 This method is called when the script initializes. It retrieves the reference to the Interactable component attached to the drill tool, which is used for tracking its attachment to a VR hand.
 
void Update ()
 This method is called once per frame and handles the interaction logic for the drill tool. It checks for user input to perform actions such as drilling and indicating.
 

Private Attributes

Interactable interactable
 

Detailed Description

Base class for all Drills.

Member Function Documentation

◆ LoadAttachment()

void Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.Drill.LoadAttachment ( GameObject  attachment,
float  offset 
)

The method loads and fixes an attachment to the drill's attachment point.

Parameters
attachmentThe attachment fixed to the drill, i.e, drillbits
offsetThe offset the attachment is fixed to the attachment point

Definition at line 102 of file Drill.cs.

◆ Start()

void Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.Drill.Start ( )
private

This method is called when the script initializes. It retrieves the reference to the Interactable component attached to the drill tool, which is used for tracking its attachment to a VR hand.

Definition at line 52 of file Drill.cs.

◆ Update()

void Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.Drill.Update ( )
private

This method is called once per frame and handles the interaction logic for the drill tool. It checks for user input to perform actions such as drilling and indicating.
